text:
Great spot, had a bunch of different tacos when I went, really liked them!
Also, the drinks are great to, they didn't have a liquor license when I went, but I know they have it now.
Looking forward to going back.

Absolutely delicious, great location, great service. We tried it on a whim and were really impressed. The mole taco was among the best mole I've had, and the cochinita pibil was smokey and delicious. Wish they had a spot like this in Brooklyn!

Pretty weak tacos.  Variety on menu looked solid, but I wasn't very impressed with the quality.  Not very flavorful.  The Al Pastor tacos in particular were disapointing.  Also, we ordered a side order of tortilla chips for $3 and they came with no salsa or anything to put on it.  You'd be better to stick with Taco Tijuana on Sherbrooke in the same neighbourhood (or Frida in St-Henri or Don Taco on St-Catherine downtown)
My daughter and I loved this spot. Great service, lovely music, delicious tacos. My favorite was taco de pescado, my daughter liked al pastor. Tasty horchata, too

I'm from California. So I have taco standards. And typically, when I'm outside of Cali I don't even bother trying tacos because I'm usually disappointed. But I've been living in Montreal for a while now and I miss that homey, nostalgic feeling of tacos, and I heard about this taco spot not too far from our place, so why not. 

First of all, it's more of a sit-down, service by a waiter/waitress kind of place, which already is a little different than what I'm used to (see: taco trucks). Nonetheless, the decor was charming and the place was clean. The menu isn't too overwhelming and the selections are interesting. One thing to note if you get the tacos: they are $3 each (a couple of them are $4 each) and you have to order a minimum of four (which means you're spending at least $12). Anyways, my partner had the al pastor, the pescado, the rajas con queso, and the mole rojo. I had the al pastor, the pescado, the tinga de pollo, and the de cochinita pibil. The tacos were tasty enough, presented on a nice plate with a little carrot and onion salad with mango dressing on the side. Not bad. Actually the mole rojo tacos were impressive, as well as the al pastor and conchinita pibil. 

HOWEVER... a couple gripes. 1) If you're going to do small tacos piled with ingredients, two tortillas are essential. It keeps the taco from falling apart and it balances the flavor with some starch. 2) Rice in a taco is a no-no. It's basically filler, adds this weird texture, and is kind of cheating. 

I think smaller tacos like the ones that Taco Bar serves are probably not for the sit-down crowd. Maybe if they served their tacos out of a truck then they wouldn't have to cut the aforementioned corners. 

All that to say... I might come back here again, but it wouldn't go out of my way.

Nouveau restaurant sur Monkland! Tout simplement bon!! Tacos en format tapas, nous avons pu en partager 8 à deux personnes avec une entrée de Guacamole! Miam!!! Et le personnel était super gentil et nous conseillait sur tout! Vraiment satisfaits, nous voulons y retourner bientôt sans hésitation !

Great new spot in the neighbourhood! Enjoyed the conchinita pibil, flank steak, rajas con queso and tinga tacos, plus the guac and chips, and they were all fantastic. NDG has been missing a really good Mexican spot for a while now, so I'm psyched to have this new addition. Will definitely be back soon!
Tout est bon et frais. Service sympathique et rapide. À essayer et on y revient ! Tous les tacos sont très bons et le tortilla au mais maison est succulent. Excellente guacamole! Merci!

J'écris peu sur Yelp. J'ai été incité à manger dans ce nouveau resto de la rue Monkland, une rue agréable, qui n'est pas reconnue pour ses haut plaisirs gastronomiques. Reste le Tavern qui s'en sort bien. Le reste est toujours sans intérêt. Nous sommes donc allés dans ce nouveau resto au décor charmant. Premier problème, aucun menu à l'extérieur. Nous sommes donc plongés tête première dans cette expérience fascinante. En arrivant, le menu sur un vague dépliant sans intérêt. Que des tacos ou presque sauf une guacamole, une salade et un riz à 6$. Un menu pour enfant en plus. Pas de carte de vins. Y a t-il du vin? Oui un seul choix de bouteille de vin à 45$, un toscan bio sans intérêt vendu 10$ aux USA.  Nous avons donc commandé la salade, la guacamole minuscule plutôt bonne et quelques tacos à la serveuse qui ne disait pas un tabarnak de mot de français. Pas un. J'aime bien le concurrent chinois magique ou le service se passe en anglais. Le problème, c'est l'attitude. Genre, je ne parle pas un mot français, la seule bouteille de vin est 45$, pis tu sais quoi mon grand(en anglais évidemment): je m'en contre-calisse. On a donc mangé nos tacos avec notre bouteille de vin ordinaire à 45$ en se disant que le decor IKEA était plutôt réussi. Question, d'ou vient l'odeur bizarre du tacos au poisson et au chou rouge? De la fraicheur du poisson? De la fermentation du chou? Et celui au au steak tiedasse sur la petite tortilla froide? Micro ondes? Déception. Quand ton menu se concentre sur un item, j'ose espérer que l'item en question soit bien fait. On peut manger des bons Tacos un peu partout a Montréal!  Or tout était franchement Médiocre. J'ai fait part de mes doléances à la serveuse en anglais, puisqu'elle ne parle pas un mot de français (et semble en être bien fière). Par la suite, on a eu droit à un refill d'eau puis une absence de sa part pour environ 30 minutes. Aucun commentaires des patrons, aucun intérêt face à la situation inacceptable. Et tout à coup, je me suis mis à rêver de voir entrer Gordon Ramsey en hurlant avec une poêle en teflon en mais, parce qu'après tout c'est tout ce qu'ils méritent. Mais malheureusement, 105$ plus tard, mes rêves ne sont pas devenus réalités. Honnêtement, je recommande le resto. Pour voir tout ce qui ne marche pas dans le domaine de la restauration. Pour apprendre tout ce qu'il ne faut pas faire. Pour apprendre comment traiter ses clients comme de la marde. Dépêchez vous, ils seront probablement fermés en septembre...

I saw so many good reviews for this restaurant but I have to say I was very disappointed. We waited a very long time for everything from menus to drinks to food to our bill. The tacos were very small and lacked a lot of flavour. What I will say is that their chips and guacamole were good and our waitress was Pleasant BUT I can safely say I will not be going back.

Taco Bar is a brand new business on Monkland.  In fact it is so new that on the night I came they had only been open about a week or so.  They have done a great job with decorating the restaurant.  The interior is quite spacious and I like the Mexican influence in the decor.  The menu focuses on tacos but there are one or two other dishes should you desire something else.

You order tacos individually here so it is easy to sample multiple tacos.  Each taco is about $3 - $4.  All the tacos I had were really delicious and flavourful.  They also use soft corn tortillas which I prefer to flour ones and the cheap hard taco shells.  The tacos were on the small side though so I wasn't as full as I was expecting to be after three tacos, which is how many I typically eat in a sitting.  I would have preferred to see them a little bigger but maybe as the business starts to get a feel for what works and what doesn't this will change.

There are some kinks with it being a new business but I think that given some time this should be worked out.  Taco Bar is certainly an excellent addition to the Monkland Village and I hope they do well.  I will definitely be putting it on my list of places to hit up when I am in the neighbourhood.

I wanted to try Taco Bar because of the good reviews on yelp and also because it's close to my place but it was honestly disappointing. I ordered delivery and got de pescado taco , de cochinita pibil taco, and the de arrachera taco with guacamole. The guacamole comes with tortilla chips so I ordered and extra side of chips for nothing. Some of the chips were very salty. The de pescado taco is marinated fish with coleslaw. There was way too much coleslaw in the taco and it was overpowering the fish. De coconuts and pibil was my favorite  out of the three tacos I ordered. It's marinated pork with red onion and habanero peppers. It tasted like a pulled pork taco very flavorful and not spicy as indicate son the menu. De arrachera is bavette marinated with spices and grilled which made the meat kind of chewy. I would not recommend this place. Check out Escondite in downtown Montreal instead!

Casual resto with tasty tacos but you must take minumun 4 tacos like mentioned in the menu... ( each small taco for 3$ ). Many tables and clean, good service but i notice that the staff have a little pressure to offert extras dishes to customers.... I was alone for lunch time and after my order i was avertise that i can take a guacamole (6$) and also a cocktail ($$) if a wish ... and when i finished to eat i was again avertise that i can take an extra taco .. I felt like taking 4 tacos for 12$ for lunch (+tx+tip) was not enough for them ... But i was full !!
